item.title: Erica add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "It was that kind of a crazy afternoon, terrifically cold, and no sun out or anything, and you felt like you were disappearing every time you crossed a road." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Erica add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "It was times like these when I thought my father, who hated guns and had never been to any wars, was the bravest man who ever lived." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Erica add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Erica add a quote by Tina Fey
item.description:
"The show doesn’t go on because it’s ready; it goes on because it’s 11:30.
This is something Lorne [Michaels] has said often about Saturday Night Live, but I think it’s a great lesson about not being too precious about your writing. You have to try your hardest to be at the top of your game and improve every joke you can until the last possible second, and then you have to let it go.
You can’t be that kid standing at the top of the waterslide, overthinking it. You have to go down the chute. (And I’m from a generation where a lot of people died on waterslides, so this was an important lesson for me to learn.) You have to let people see what you wrote. It will never be perfect, but perfect is overrated. Perfect is boring on live TV.
What I learned about ‘bombing’ as an improviser at Second City was that bombing is painful, but it doesn’t kill you. No matter how badly an improv set goes, you will still be physically alive when it’s over. What I learned about bombing as a writer at Saturday Night is that you can’t be too worried about your ‘permanent record.’ Yes, you’re going to write some sketches that you love and are proud of forever—your golden nuggets. But you’re also going to write some real shit nuggets. And unfortunately, sometimes the shit nuggets will make it onto the air. You can’t worry about it. As long as you know the difference, you can go back to panning for gold on Monday." -- Tina Fey

item.title: Erica add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Erica add a quote by Judy Blume
item.description: "Let children read whatever they want and then talk about it with them. If parents and kids can talk together, we won't have as much censorship because we won't have as much fear." -- Judy Blume

item.title: Erica add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Wicked people never have time for reading. It's one of the reasons for their wickedness." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Erica add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Everyone should be able to do one card trick, tell two jokes, and recite three poems, in case they are ever trapped in an elevator." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Erica add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "A good library will never be too neat, or too dusty, because somebody will always be in it, taking books off the shelves and staying up late reading them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Erica add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Well-read people are less likely to be evil." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Erica add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "It is always sad when someone leaves home, unless they are simply going around the corner and will return in a few minutes with ice-cream sandwiches." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Erica add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "If writers wrote as carelessly as some people talk, then adhasdh asdglaseuyt[bn[ pasdlgkhasdfasdf." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Erica add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "All the secrets of the world are contained in books. Read at your own risk." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Erica add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Reading is one form of escape. Running for your life is another." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Erica add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "The world is quiet here." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Erica add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "What really knocks me out is a book that, when you're all done reading it, you wish the author that wrote it was a terrific friend of yours and you could call him up on the phone whenever you felt like it. That doesn't happen much, though." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Erica add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Until I feared I would lose it, I never loved to read. One does not love breathing." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Erica add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "I want God to play in my bloodstream the way sunlight amuses itself on the water." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Erica add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "Still, despite all this, traveling is the great true love of my life. I have always felt, ever since I was sixteen years old and first went to Russia with my saved-up babysitting money, that to travel is worth any cost or sacrifice. I am loyal and constant in my love for travel, as I have not always been loyal and constant in my other loves. I feel about travel the way a happy new mother feels about her impossible, colicky, restless, newborn baby--I just don't care what it puts me through. Because I adore it. Because it's mine. Because it looks exactly like me. It can barf all over me if it wants to--I just don't care." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Erica add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "I crossed the street to walk in the sunshine." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Erica add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "Both the five-year-olds looked at me with bewilderment and a bit of fearful uncertainty. I had a sudden horrifying image of the woman I might become if I'm not careful: Crazy Aunt Liz. The divorcee in the muumuu with the dyed orange hair who doesn't eat dairy but smokes menthols, who's always just coming back from her astrology cruise or breaking up with her aroma-therapist boyfriend, who reads the Tarot cards of kindergarteners and says things like, "Bring Aunty Liz another wine cooler, baby, and I'll let you wear my mood ring..." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Erica add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "Every word was a singing sparrow, a magic trick, a truffle for me. The words made me laugh in delight." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Erica add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "To my taste, the men in Rome are ridiculously, hurtfully, stupidly beautiful. More beautiful even than Roman women, to be honest. Italian men are beautiful in the same way as French women, which is to say-- no detail spared in the quest for perfection. They’re like show poodles. Sometimes they look so good I want to applaud." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Erica add a quote by Nancy Horan
item.description: "There's a phrase over the door; she called to him. "Haec est porta coeli."..."Here is the gate to heaven." -- Nancy Horan

item.title: Erica add a quote by Frances Mayes
item.description: "I had the urge to examine my life in another culture and move beyond what I knew." -- Frances Mayes

item.title: Erica add a quote by Frances Mayes
item.description: "There is so much jasmine and nightshade in the garden that we all wake with lyrical headaches." -- Frances Mayes

item.title: Erica add a quote by Frances Mayes
item.description: "Behind sunglasses we linger over espresso, talking about pizza as an art form, the geekiness of people's travel clothes..." -- Frances Mayes

item.title: Erica add a quote by Frances Mayes
item.description: "[As Chevalley says,] 'Sicilians never want to improve for the simple reason that they think themselves perfect..." -- Frances Mayes

item.title: Erica add a quote by Frances Mayes
item.description: "...outrageous flowers swagging off balconies like bright skirts of ballgowns..." -- Frances Mayes

item.title: Erica add a quote by Frances Mayes
item.description: "If I lived here,...I have a feeling this place would take me." -- Frances Mayes
